page.title: 08Rotherwas Chapel.
page.content:
{Rotherwas Chapel}served the Bodenham family until the house was finally demolished between the two World Wars.
The building dates back to the{13th {Century}but the roof ,its main feature, was built in 1580. It is a superb example of{Elizabethan workmanship, Queen posters and King posters enabling the roof to be carried without the use of supporting pillars.This leaves the chapel spacious and light and the{'Medieval' atmosphere is retained.
Until recently it was in a poor state of repair. The{National Trust are now restoring it and the chapel will be used as a{museum.
